sentence.Network_en: Pockets of affluence coexist with poverty.
sentence.Network_cn: 少数富裕地区与贫困地区并存。

sentence.Network_en: Their affluence is more apparent than real.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的富有是虚有其表.

sentence.Network_en: For them, affluence was bought at the price of less freedom in their work environment.
sentence.Network_cn: 对他们来说，富足是以减少在工作场所的自由为代价才获得的。

list.abs: this will attract greater affluence as well as homelessness counterbalance ., 这将吸引越来越多的财富 , 并反之带来无家可归者.
以本书的核心主题富裕大众（mass affluence）来说，从一九五八年约翰‧肯尼斯‧高伯瑞（John Kenneth Galbraith）出版极具影响力 …
...ource of getting rich and of making progress afterbecoming affluence 两思（致富思源，富而思进）virtuous circle 良性循环
in a truly interconnected world , more affluence and activity globally can be a universal benefit . U.在一个真正相互依存的世界里，更多的财富和全球性的活动都可能成为全人类的福祉。

entry.def: Affluence is the state of having a lot of money or a high standard of living.

example.ex: The postwar era was one of new affluence for the working class.
example.tran: 战后是工人阶级富裕起来的全新时期。

auth_sentence.content: This is not a life choice constructed in the heady embrace of affluence.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is not a life choice constructed in the heady embrace of affluence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is not a life choice constructed in the heady embrace of affluence.

auth_sentence.content: "I would affluence test all of those people," he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: "I would affluence test all of those people," he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "I would affluence test all of those people," he said.

Sentence.sentence: Late-stage developing nations that are currently industrialising rapidly, for example China, which will experience declining rates of population growth, coupled with increasing affluence (富裕）and age profile.

sentences.en: Their affluence is more apparent than real.
sentences.cn: 他们的富有是虚有其表。

sentences.en: There is a lot of affluence in this part of the state because it has many businesses.
sentences.cn: 这个州的这一部分相当富有, 因为它有很多商行。

sentences.en: a autumn with its affluence of rains
the affluence of blood to the heart
